update.description:
Issue 1: Full screen anti-aliasing is broken in ogre < 1.8. The render texture will not update properly if fsaa is used.

Issue 2: Model shading was poor when using ModelPropShopPlugin to generate images. I added a light that moves to illuminate the model. This required a tweak the Light class.

Issue 3: Fix spelling in gzprop man page.

Issue 4: gzprop assumed model.sdf in the given model directory. The user must now specify the complete sdf file to use.

How to test:
  1. $ gzprop <model_director/model.sdf>

  1. Unpack the resulting tarball.

  1. Check the images in <model_name>/meta/

Note that this is going into default because ThePropShop will not be available for use until Gazebo 3.0
update.title: Updates to propshop plugin and tweaks to rendering

pull_request.title: Updates to propshop plugin and tweaks to rendering

content.raw:
That's even better. The patch was just a quick fix because I wanted to make a concrete suggestion and not a complaint.

The only trick will be finding the model name. You may be able to get that from the model.config or by calling `pwd`.

pullrequest.title: Updates to propshop plugin and tweaks to rendering

content.raw:
Looks good to me.

Just noticed a minor corner case in gzprop where it fails if you pass a file in the current directory, ie:
~~~
$ pwd
/home/ubuntu/.gazebo/models/pr2
$ gzprop model.sdf
/home/ubuntu/bin/gzprop:50:in `mkdir': Permission denied - /meta (Errno::EACCES)
	from /home/ubuntu/bin/gzprop:50:in `<main>'
~~~
It tries and fails to create a folder named /meta (definitely don't recommend to use sudo).

The following patch should detect this case and give an appropriate error message:
~~~
diff -r 5560c69c3e56 tools/gzprop
--- a/tools/gzprop	Mon Feb 24 09:52:43 2014 -0800
+++ b/tools/gzprop	Tue Feb 25 12:16:39 2014 -0800
@@ -24,7 +24,7 @@
   abort("")
 end
 
-# Get the model directory
+# Get the model file name
 modelFile = ARGV[0]
 
 modelParts = modelFile.split('/')
@@ -35,6 +35,11 @@
   abort("Missing model file [#{modelFile}]")
 end
 
+# Make sure the file wasn't specified in the current directory
+if modelDir.empty?
+  abort("Cannot specify file in the current directory")
+end
+
 # Get the name of the model (last part of the directory name)
 modelName = modelParts[-2]
 
~~~
content.html:
Looks good to me.

Just noticed a minor corner case in gzprop where it fails if you pass a file in the current directory, ie:

$ pwd
/home/ubuntu/.gazebo/models/pr2
$ gzprop model.sdf
/home/ubuntu/bin/gzprop:50:in `mkdir': Permission denied - /meta (Errno::EACCES)
    from /home/ubuntu/bin/gzprop:50:in `<main>'

It tries and fails to create a folder named /meta (definitely don't recommend to use sudo).

The following patch should detect this case and give an appropriate error message:

diff -r 5560c69c3e56 tools/gzprop
--- a/tools/gzprop  Mon Feb 24 09:52:43 2014 -0800
+++ b/tools/gzprop  Tue Feb 25 12:16:39 2014 -0800
@@ -24,7 +24,7 @@
   abort("")
 end

-# Get the model directory
+# Get the model file name
 modelFile = ARGV[0]

 modelParts = modelFile.split('/')
@@ -35,6 +35,11 @@
   abort("Missing model file [#{modelFile}]")
 end

+# Make sure the file wasn't specified in the current directory
+if modelDir.empty?
+  abort("Cannot specify file in the current directory")
+end
+
 # Get the name of the model (last part of the directory name)
 modelName = modelParts[-2]

pullrequest.title: Updates to propshop plugin and tweaks to rendering

content.raw:
It seems like after the change to the startup sequence it's hanging on [this line](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/fab31545a57692676adef43dff51cf7b31075740/plugins/ModelPropShop.cc#cl-116) `this->factoryPub->WaitForConnection();`. 

I had to make a couple of minor changes, see [propshop_fixes_ian](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/948ac80c198e40a6b44057a2b488977953deda71), to get it going, mainly by delaying the factory msg publishing and fixing a `boost::lock_error` when shutting down gazebo.
content.html:
It seems like after the change to the startup sequence it's hanging on this line this->factoryPub->WaitForConnection();.

I had to make a couple of minor changes, see propshop_fixes_ian, to get it going, mainly by delaying the factory msg publishing and fixing a boost::lock_error when shutting down gazebo.
